title: New Champs are not OP (most of the time). Its just an Ilusion
body:
So i see this with every new champ that comes out, the good'ol "OP please Nerf" threads that swarm the boards (yes i know there are some champs that have been genuinely OP).

But the reality is that it really is just an illusion of strength because a very small number of people know how to counter/play the new champ. i feel that you need to give a reasonable amount of time (seeing how they perform in the competitive scene) after a champ has be released before crying OP.

Just a bit tired of seeing the same old Rito please nerf threads

replies.body:
The OP can be real, but not to the extent that everyone says it is. Remember, these champions are tested and changed on the PBE too.
We get the same illusion of "This champ is %%%%" as well, I think, due to the number of people who can't play said champion.
yeah its just the unfamiliarity that makes them seem op

And even then, when a champ comes out (like {{champion:150}} and {{champion:268}}  ) people will try them out for a couple of games and then decide that they are weak and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ champions. After a while, the people who were genuinely interested in the champions and learnt to play them well prove that they are strong.  And the people who left after a couple of tries start shouting 'OP' and they will be nerved.

Another example was the numerous threads about how OP {{champion:25}} is. She isn't OP at all. Counterplaying a morgana is super easy. 


TL;DR The types of people who post those {{item:3070}} threads, don't have the time or skill to learn how to counter play.
